answers.answer: _Dear Nathan, you are correct.  An ACE inhibitor is beneficial for both diabetes and congestive heart failure.  Unless such a medication cannot be tolerated, most patients with either diabetes or heart failure should be treated with this medication.  Thank you for your input.

question: : I have been recently diagnosed diabetic, type 2.  I also have CHF,: atrial fibrillation, pacemaker, previous stroke.   I am taking  medications: for diabetes now and still have a hard time getting readings in a normal: range.  Since I do not see the doctor until next week, can you tell me: how the diabetes can cause complications with my other problems?: My primary and cardio docs seem extremely worried about this combination.: Thanks so much for your time.
title: How does diabetes complicate heart conditions?
